lessons.title: What Proofreading Is (And Isn't)
lessons.why: If you don't understand where proofreading ends and copy-editing begins, you'll overstep — or underdeliver.
concepts: The proof stage in publishing workflow
What you're checking (typesetter errors, missed errors)
What you're NOT checking (style rewrites, content changes)
lessons.exercise: Identify which corrections belong at proof stage vs copy-edit stage

lessons.title: Marking Up a PDF
lessons.why: Spotting errors means nothing if you can't communicate them clearly. The typesetter reads your marks, not your mind.
concepts: Why colour conventions (red = correction, yellow = query)
Strikethrough, Insert, Replace, Highlight, Sticky Note
lessons.exercise: Mark up a practice PDF with planted errors

lessons.title: Spelling and House Style
lessons.why: Consistency is kindness. Readers stumble when 'realise' becomes 'realize' mid-chapter.
concepts: -ise vs -ize (Hart's: both acceptable, but be consistent)
Checking against house style, not personal preference
lessons.exercise: Identify spelling inconsistencies in a passage

lessons.title: Punctuation: Dialogue
lessons.why: Dialogue is where readers hear the characters. Wrong punctuation breaks the voice.
concepts: Double quotes for quotes within dialogue
Punctuation inside vs outside quotes (logical style)
lessons.exercise: Correct dialogue punctuation in a fiction passage

lessons.title: Punctuation: Dashes and Ellipses
lessons.why: A hyphen is not a dash. An en-dash is not an em-dash. These tiny marks carry meaning.
concepts: British convention: spaced en-dash vs unspaced em-dash
Ellipses: three dots, spacing, when to use
lessons.exercise: Standardise dash and ellipsis usage in a passage

lessons.title: Consistency: Names and Terms
lessons.why: The reader trusts you. If 'Catherine' becomes 'Katherine' on page 50, that trust breaks.
concepts: Terminology consistency (is it 'grey' or 'gray' in this book?)
Creating a style sheet as you proofread
lessons.exercise: Create a style sheet from a passage and identify inconsistencies

lessons.title: Hyphenation and Compounds
lessons.why: A 'man eating shark' is different from a 'man-eating shark'. Hyphens clarify meaning.
concepts: Compound adjectives after nouns (the author is well known)
Prefixes: when to hyphenate (re-cover vs recover)
lessons.exercise: Correct hyphenation in a fiction passage

lessons.title: Numbers, Dates, and Times
lessons.why: Nothing screams 'amateur' like inconsistent number treatment. Spell out or use figures — but be consistent.
concepts: Spell out one to one hundred (Hart's fiction convention)
Figures for specific measurements, times, dates
Time format (8.30 a.m. or 8:30 am — pick one)
lessons.exercise: Standardise number treatment in a passage

lessons.title: Queries: When to Ask, Not Fix
lessons.why: A proofreader who changes everything is dangerous. A proofreader who asks the right questions is invaluable.
concepts: How to write a good query (specific, neutral, actionable)
lessons.exercise: Identify which items need queries vs corrections

lessons.title: Full Proof: Putting It Together
lessons.why: You've learned the pieces. Now prove you can do the whole job.
concepts: Full workflow: first read, markup, review
lessons.exercise: Proofread a complete fiction excerpt to professional standard
